Message:
All I remember about my father
is the feeling of his big hand
softly petting my head.

My grandmother told me
that he was a soldier...
and that he died in battle.

Since the day I was born,
this country has been in
a constant state of war.

On the border, in a village
said to have been founded
by a witch,

I was born and raised
by my grandmother.

When my sickly mother
heard of my father’s death,
she collapsed,

and has been hospitalized
in the capital ever since.

I’m only able to visit her
once or twice each year.

Despite that though,
it’s thanks to those three
that I never succumbed
to loneliness.
